intro: Betonica alopecuros subsp. jacquinii, commonly known as Jacquin's betony, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of blue to violet flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
